channel.title: Need help finishing this code

item.title: Need help finishing this code
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

[quote=“MrFun, post:3, topic:517523”][quote author=arham 4 link=topic=635784.msg4286777#msg4286777 date=1366473488]
Why are you adding if you can just make it equal?
Should be:

specialAmount = 100;

Instead of:

specialAmount += 100;

[/quote]
well I added the += because im adding to the special…so the = will be adding the special to 100 then stop?[/quote]

Technically no. the ++ prefix increment operator adds to the value of the variable.

i = 4; system.out.println(++i); //5
Prefixing is adding to the number before it is executed in the operation. You should just be checking for equality which is the ‘=’ operator.

http://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/java/nutsandbolts/operators.html

Read full topic

item.title: Need help finishing this code
item.dc:creator: @Sup22211 Sup22211
item.description:
@Sup22211 wrote:

Yes, what they said but if you still want to know how to do that the special will not go above 100:
if(specialAmount >= 100){
specialAmount = 100;
}
Checking if its more/equals to 100 and if it do it will set the special to 100.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help finishing this code
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

Plus-equals

The plus-equals operator (+=) adds the value on the right, to the variable on the left, and then assigns that value back into the variable on the left.

Example:

int a = 6; // assigns the value 6 to variable a a += 5; // adds 5 to a, and assigns that value back into a, now a is 11

Read full topic

item.title: Need help finishing this code
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“MrFun, post:3, topic:517523”][quote author=arham 4 link=topic=635784.msg4286777#msg4286777 date=1366473488]
Why are you adding if you can just make it equal?
Should be:

specialAmount = 100;

Instead of:

specialAmount += 100;

[/quote]
well I added the += because im adding to the special…so the = will be adding the special to 100 then stop?[/quote]
It sets the special amount. A plain = sign in this case is to set.

So, if my special amount is 25, it will set it to 100, if my special amount is 50, it will, again, set it to 100.

Read full topic
